column5: Hey folks,  What are your favourite brook trout spoons? I like the Gold William Wabler (i think it's 2.5"). I also like the EPG's(sp?) - it's a black, gold and spotted spoon but not easy to find nor cheap!  I'm interested to know what else you folks use to troll and/or cast to brookies? Has anyone tried trolling a spinner while canoeing or does this lead to a lot of line spin?
small size little cleo in burgundy/ bronze
Yep, EGB's and smallest Little Cleos.  I like the Cleos with the hammered finish...1/2 Silver and 1/2 Green or Blue.
What size Cleo's you guys use? 1/4 oz or smaller?
the doctor spoon...  silver on the outside, 24k gold on the inside.
Buckshots...orange colour...awsome...  .and yes, trolling spinners works wonders...just use an inline swivel 2-3 feet up from your lure to help reduce line twist.
Thanks... what size spinners do u use?
Mepps #2 Black Fury......  :worthy:  :worthy:   For spoons lil Wolf
#1 and #2 EGB's in various colours. Phoebe's in copper, gold and metallic perch.
lucky strike halfwave in gold, 2 inch  deadly!! canadian tire used to sell for 2 bucks but no more, only in the soo at the trading post but over 5 bucks!!
Never mind about phoebes, nothing nothing nothing, nothing to see here,  just move along.  They never catch nothing, double negatives included.
My favorite Brook Trout spoon isn't even a spoon. It's a Rap countdown or a jig(fly).
EGB's Cleos and a little dartee!  Have had a lot of success with the dartee.

My favourite are EGB # 1 and# 2 in the trout parr finish. But I also like trolling Panther Martins tipped with dewage(see my upcoming long weekend report). Also cant beleive theres no love for ole Len Thompson he still gets a wash every now and then from me in both the five of diamonds and frog patterns.
